medical_history.chief_complaint: An 80-year-old man with end-stage renal disease presented with anorexia, weight loss, abdominal pain, diarrhea, and an ileocecal mass.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms have been present for several years and have included intermittent abdominal pain, diarrhea, gastrointestinal bleeding, and weight loss. There was a significant decrease in weight from 78.0 kg to 65.3 kg over three years. Symptoms of diarrhea returned three to four times a day after a previous course of treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: End-stage renal disease, type 2 diabetes mellitus, peripheral arterial disease, hypertension, coronary arteriosclerosis, congestive heart failure, abdominal aortic aneurysm, hyperlipidemia, gout, previous pulmonary nodule diagnosed and monitored.
medical_history.social_history: Patient emigrated from Southeast Asia 22 years earlier, lives in an urban area of New England, drinks alcohol rarely, does not smoke or use illicit drugs.
